text.div:
Generated Narrative: StructureDefinition IMMZC4

Profiles: CRMI Shareable StructureDefinition, CRMI Publishable StructureDefinition

NameFlagsCard.TypeDescription & Constraints
IMMZC4 0..*BaseIMMZ.C4.Create client record
uniqueIdentifier 1..1stringUnique identifier
name C1..1stringName
Constraints: IMMZ-C-name-1
firstName C0..1stringFirst name
Constraints: IMMZ-C-name-1
familyName C0..1stringFamily name
Constraints: IMMZ-C-name-1
sex 1..1codeSex
Binding: IMMZ.C.DE5 ValueSet for Sex (required)
dateOfBirth 1..1stringDate of birth
age C0..1stringAge
Constraints: IMMZ-C-age-1
caregiversMultiple 0..*BackboneElementCaregivers (multiple)
caregiversFullName C0..1stringCaregiver's full name
Constraints: IMMZ-C-name-1
caregiversFirstName C0..1stringCaregiver's first name
Constraints: IMMZ-C-name-1
caregiversFamilyName C0..1stringCaregiver's family name
Constraints: IMMZ-C-name-1
contactPhoneNumber 1..1stringContact phone number
address 1..1stringAddress

Documentation for this format

name: IMMZ_C4_Create_client_record
title: IMMZ.C4.Create client record
description: Data elements for the IMMZ.C4.Create client record Data Dictionary Activity.  Identical to IMMZ.C5.3.Update client details.

mapping.name: Mapping from the IMMZ.C4 to the IMMZPatient profile
Mapping from the IMMZ.C4 to the IMMZCaregiver (RelatedPerson) profile

element.definition: Data elements for the IMMZ.C4.Create client record Data Dictionary Activity.  Identical to IMMZ.C5.3.Update client details.

Unique identifier for the client, according to the policies applicable to each country. There can be more than one unique identifier used to link records (e.g. national identification [ID], health ID, immunization information system ID, medical record ID)
The full name of the client

constraint.human: Only letters and special characters (period, dash) allowed.

element.definition: Client's first name or given name

constraint.human: Only letters and special characters (period, dash) allowed.

element.definition: Client's family name or last name

constraint.human: Only letters and special characters (period, dash) allowed.

element.definition: Documentation of a specific instance of sex information for the client
Client's date of birth (DOB) if known; if unknown, use assigned DOB for administrative purposes

code.display: Current age or age at death

element.definition: The client's calculated age (presented as number of years, months, weeks, days) based on the DOB and the visit date

constraint.human: Required if date of birth is entered.

element.definition: Details of the client's caregiver (person) who could be next of kin (e.g. partner, husband, mother, sibling, etc.)

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

slicing.description: Extensions are always sliced by (at least) url

element.definition: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.
element.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.short: Extensions that cannot be ignored even if unrecognized
element.definition:
May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element and that modifies the understanding of the element in which it is contained and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.

Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).
element.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.
element.requirements: Modifier extensions allow for extensions that *cannot* be safely ignored to be clearly distinguished from the vast majority of extensions which can be safely ignored.  This promotes interoperability by eliminating the need for implementers to prohibit the presence of extensions. For further information, see the [definition of modifier extensions](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/extensibility.html#modifierExtension).

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.isModifierReason: Modifier extensions are expected to modify the meaning or interpretation of the element that contains them

element.definition: The full name of the client's caregiver

constraint.human: Only letters and special characters (period, dash) allowed.

element.definition: First or given name of the client's caregiver

constraint.human: Only letters and special characters (period, dash) allowed.

element.definition: Family name or last name of the client's caregiver

constraint.human: Only letters and special characters (period, dash) allowed.

element.definition: Client's phone number; can be a landline or a mobile phone number
Client's home address or address that the client is consenting to disclose
